ab.title: Deuteronomy 21
ab.l: If a dead |man| is found in the land which the Lord your God is giving to youto possess, fallen in the field, |and| if it is not known who has killedhim,
Then your elders and your judges shall come out,and they shall measure to the cities which are around the dead |man|.
And it shall be, the city which is nearest to the dead |man|:and the elders of that city shall take a calf of a cattle whichhas never been used for work and which has not pulled in the yoke.
And the elders of that city shall bring down the calfto a tough valley that is not worked with and it is not sown,and they shall stab the calf to death there in the valley.

And the priests, sons of Levi, shall come near, becausethe Lord your God has chosen them to minister to him andto bless Israel in the name of the Lord, and by their wordis every verdict and every illness.
And all the elders of that city that are nearest to the dead |man|shall wash their hands over the calfwhich was stabbed to death in the valley by the river.
And they shall begin and say, “Our hands have not spilledthis blood, and our eyes have not seen himwho killed him.

Forgive the sin of your peopleIsrael, whom you have redeemed, oh Lord, and do not set the guilt of innocentblood in the midst of your people Israel.” Andthe guilt of innocent blood will be forgiven them.
So shall you drive awaythe guilt of innocent blood from the midst of you, when you will do what is rightin the eyes of the Lord.Parashat Ki Teitzei
When you will go out to waragainst your enemies, and the Lordyour God will give them into your hands, and you will take captive their captives,
And you will see a beautiful woman in captivity, and you will loveher and take her to be your wife,
Thenyou shall bring her into your house, and she shall make the hair of her head be shaved,and she shall trim her nails,

And she shall remove the clothing of her captivityfrom off her. And she shall live in your house and crybecause of her father and her mother a month of days. Andafter that you shall come to her and marry her, and she shall beyour wife.

And it shall be, if you do not loveher, you shall let her go into another |man’s| possession, and you shall not sell herfor silver. You shall not get profit through her, becauseyou have oppressed her.
If a man has twowives, one beloved and the other despised, andthey have borne him children, both the beloved and the despised,and if the firstborn son be of the wife that is despised,
Then it shall be, when he makes his sons to inherit that whichhe has, that he shall not be able to make the son ofthe beloved firstborn before the son of the despised,|before| the firstborn,
That he shall recognize the son of the despised,to give him two portions of all thathe has, because he is the first of his strength. The right of thefirstbornhood is his.
If a man has a stubbornand rebellious son who does not obey the voice of his father or the voiceof his mother, and if they discipline him, and if he does not listen to them,
Then his father and his mother shall hold himand bring him out to the elders of his city and to the court of justiceof his place.
And they shall say to the eldersof his city, “This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious,he does not listen to our voice, he eats a lot of meat and drinks a lot of wine.”
And all the people of his city shall stone himwith stones, so that he dies. So shall you drive the evil awayfrom the midst of you, and all Israel shall hear and fear.
And if a man has a sin, a sentence of death, andhe is put to death, and you hang him on a tree,

His body shall not remain all night on the tree, becauseyou shall surely bury him that day: because an accursed of every man is thishanged person by the greatness of his sin which insulted the word of God,and you shall not defile your land that the Lord your Godis giving you as an inheritance.
